newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Brent and NYMEX slide continues in Asia.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Brent and NYMEX slide continues in Asia.

text.p: Crude futures in Asia were weaker on Monday, continuing to test lower prices following last week's bearish tone.
March Brent, trading on SIMEX, was quoted at $22.40/$22.55 per barrel after London shed 53 cents to settle at $22.54.
NYMEX February crude was last traded at $25.21, down 20 cents from the New York close, where the contract fell 11 cents.
Brokers said the market's technicals were driving prices down. March Brent would look to hold above $22.50 to try to stave off further losses. London's intraday low was $22.53.
But they said the bears would target $22.00 -- a downward spike hit in December and the lowest price at the time for three months.
But much would depend on U.S. products, which were leading the oil complex.
February heating on ACCESS continued to slide in Asia time, dropping 0.39 cent to 68.05 cents per gallon.
